note: CP1252 is a character set and an encoding.

characterSetUse: Character set of the original IBM PC. This character set remains the primary set in the core of any EGA and VGA-compatible graphics card. Text shown when a PC reboots, before any other font can be loaded from a storage medium, typically is rendered in this character set.[note 1] Many file formats developed at the time of the IBM PC are based on code page 437 as well.
Very similar to ISO 8859-1 character set.

setLongName: American Standard Code for Information Interchange
note: ASCII is a character set an an encoding.

setLongName: Extended Binary Coded Decimal Interchange Code
characterSetUse: An eight-bit character set used mainly on IBM mainframe and IBM midrange computer operating systems.
